Text: The title Earl of Dunbar, also called Earl of Lothian or Earl of March, was the head of a comital lordship in south-eastern Scotland between the early 12th century and the early 15th century.

Text: Earl of Dunbar:  It descended to George de Dunbar, 11th Earl of March, who was forfeited by parliament of his titles & estates in 1435, and retired into obscurity in England.
Triplets:<Earl of Dunbar

--------------------
<Text: Earl of Dunbar:  His son Patrick retained a barony at Kilconquhar in Fife.>
